isis.stitle: 10 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS FULLER RT-610 SERIES - INSTALL - AUXILIARY SECTION

note.para: The two reverse gears, including the washers, must be in perfect alignment with the center of the case bores as the front of the auxiliary countershafts must be inserted in these parts during auxiliary installation. A heavy grease or lubriplate will help hold the washers in place. Also check the rear of the front section to make sure all snap rings have been installed ( Figure 173).

figure.caption: Figure 173. Make Sure All Snap Rings Have Been Installed

step1.para: Install the auxiliary section on the front section, aligning the auxiliary section on the dowel pins and the extended portion of the auxiliary countershafts with the reverse idler gears. It may make assembly easier if someone slowly rotates the input shaft during installation ( Figure 174).

figure.caption: Figure 174. Install Auxiliary Section on Front Section

note.para: The auxiliary can also be installed with the front section in a vertical position. Place the clutch housing on blocks and use chain hoist to lower the auxiliary section into position ( Figure 175).

step1.para: Secure the auxiliary with attaching bolts. Tighten bolts to 35 to 45 ft-lbs. (47 to 61 N· m).

figure.caption: Figure 175. Auxiliary Can Be Installed With Front Section in Vertical Position
